current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To establish a loan guarantee program for natural gas distribution grids to be installed in areas
			 with extremely high energy costs.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Fuel Grid Distribution Loan Pilot Program Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Fuel Grid Distribution Loan Pilot Program Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Fuel distribution utility pilot loan program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 232(c) of the Department of Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Department of Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994/s:232/ss:c
Department of Agriculture Reorganization Act of 1994/s:232/ss:c/p:1/sp:B

text.#text: by adding at the end the following:

short-title.#text: Fuel Grid Distribution Loan Pilot Program Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Fuel Grid Distribution Loan Pilot Program Act/s:2

text.#text: The biofuels and natural gas distribution utility pilot loan program authorized by

a
		county, municipality, city, town, township, local public authority, school
		district, special district, intrastate district, council of governments
		(regardless of whether the council of governments is incorporated as a
		nonprofit corporation under State law), regional or interstate government
		entity, or agency or instrumentality of a local government;

an Indian tribe
		or authorized tribal organization or, in Alaska, a Native village or Alaska
		Regional Native Corporation; and

a rural
		community, unincorporated town or village, or other public
		entity.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish a biofuels and natural gas
			 distribution utility
			 pilot loan program to add cooperatives and municipally or privately owned
			 biofuels or natural gas
			 distribution utilities to the list of utilities eligible to receive loans
			 from the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the Rural Utilities Service

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Fuel Grid Distribution Loan Pilot Program Act/s:2/ss:b/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall grant loans only to utilities serving an area under the jurisdiction
			 of a local government that has—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the Rural Utilities Service

text.#text: a population of not more than 50,000 people; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: using the most recent data available.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the Energy Information Administration

text.#text:
energy prices
			 higher than 200 percent of the national average for energy prices, as
			 determined by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall carry out the loan pilot program using
			 existing funds of the Rural Utilities Service.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the Rural Utilities Service

text.#text:
The loan pilot program shall be authorized for a period of 5 years, beginning on the date of
			 enactment of this Act.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Administrator of the Rural Utilities Service

text.#text: At the conclusion of the loan pilot program, the
the economic benefits of providing low cost loans; and

any upward price pressure on biofuels or natural gas prices in the United States resulting from the
			 loan pilot
			 program.
